title: Part a
stimulusHtml:
Mass of Water: 10 gal X 8 lb/gal = 80 lbs Water

Energy to heat Water: 80 lb X 90°F X 1 BTU/°(F•lb = 7200 BTU
(ΔT)

Energy to run dishwasher: 0.500 KWH X 3400 BTU/KWH = 1700 BTU

Total Energy for Dishwasher = 7200 BTU + 1700 BTU = 8900 BTU

Notes:

If no calculations are shown, no points awarded.

If student does not show specific heat (1 BTU/°(F•lb), but still gets correct answer - OK

If units are not shown - OK

Correct setup, incorrect addition or multiplication - OK

title: Part b
stimulusHtml:
Mass of Water: 20 gal X 8 lb/gal = 160 lbs Water

Total Energy for Hand Washing = 160 lb X 60°F X 1 BTU/°F•lb = 9600 BTU

(ΔT)

Notes:

If no calculations are shown, no points awarded.

If student does not show specific heat (1 BTU/°(F•lb), but still gets correct answer - OK

If units are not shown - OK

Correct setup, incorrect addition or multiplication - OK

title: Part c
stimulusHtml:
i) Electric Dishwasher (1 COST and 1 BENEFIT, either economic or environmental required)

COST

Economic: Manufacture - (materials, labor, natural resources)

Disposal - (transport, fees, etc)

Acquisition of dishwasher (expensive)

Environmental: Pollution (mining, refining, shipping, etc.)

Solid waste/disposal (landfill, open spaces)

Detergents (high phosphates)

BENEFIT

Economic: Uses less energy (cheaper)

Employs people (sales, production, transport)

Existence helps drive consumer economy

Saves time (must specify how related to economics)

Parts/Machine can be recycled (jobs, materials)

Water temperature higher (more sanitary)

Environmental: Uses less energy (conserves fossil fuels)

Uses less water (treatment costs lower, less impact on aquifers, etc)

ii) Hand Washing (1 COST and 1 BENEFIT, either economic or environmental required)

COST

Economic:Uses more energy (more expensive)

More time consuming (labor costs)

Not stimulating high-tech society

Environmental: Uses more water (treatment, aquifers)

Uses more energy (more fossil fuels used)

BENEFIT

Economic: Employs unskilled/handicapped labor

Non-acquisition of dishwasher (saves $$)

Environmental: Substitutes machine power for human labor

Phosphate-free hand washing detergents

Longer lifetime (durability, replacement, repair)

Landfilling requires less space

Notes:

No credit for questioning assumptions

Just lissing ideas = NO CREDIT; discussion of cost/benefit required

Examples:

listing pollution (water, air, etc) is not enough; must discuss

in part (c) i), less water and (c) ii), more water = 0 pt.

simply stating "time saving" not enough; must relate to economy to get 1 pt.

Flippant answer = NO CREDIT; answer must relate to economics or environment

If calculations in parts (a) and (b) are reversed (e.g., dishwasher requires more energy than hand washing), but part (c) is interpreted correctly based on these calculations, full credit allowed; no double jeopardy.
